JobDescReq: The Investment Analyst will work under the supervision of our experienced and highly supportive Portfolio Analyst to help drive the commercial portfolio data strategy. The role will assist in developing commercial data capability, analytics solutions and portfolio insights across all the Hejaz Group’s product offerings. This role has a strong focus on financial data. To be successful in this role you will have positive friendly attitude and a strong interest in financial data analytics. We will provide the tools and support to set you up for success. Main ResponsibilitiesReview fund-related investment opportunities for investment and divestment of assets and significant asset management activities.Review financial results, metrics, and other key drivers of fund investment performance.Source and consolidate information from asset and investment managers, fund accountants, market commentators and other subject matter experts to deliver value-added insights.Assist in the coordination of service providers that are integral to the operational success of the fund, e.g., annual valuation process, periodic distributions, fund accounting and reporting, annual audit process and other compliance matters.Assist with operational matters including maintenance of finance-related tasks and customer management system. Essential RequirementsMust have Tertiary qualifications in Finance or Economics. Strong analytical skills with an understanding of Equities and REITs.Advanced numerical, reconciliation, and problem-solving skills.High level of competency with Excel.Advanced knowledge of products and services within the financial services Industry.Previous experience in data analysis for investment and resource portfolio highly regarded.Previous experience at a Security Firm, Asset Management Company, Fund Company, or Private Equity Company. High level of attention to detail and good organizational skills.Previous experience in the financial services industry is highly regarded. Desirable Experience and SkillsExperience in the banking and financial services industry highly regarded.Experience working in a fast-paced and medium enterprise environment highly regarded. It is a great opportunity to be part of a fast-growing organization with opportunities for career development and progression. In return, you will be rewarded for your drive to make a positive impact on the Hejaz team. To submit your application, please click on “Apply” to send your CV and cover letter. Only shortlisted applicants will be contacted. We reserve the right to close this vacancy early if we have received sufficient applications and suitable applicants have been selected for the role. Therefore, if you are interested, please submit your application as early as possible. Learn more about Hejaz and our business by visiting our website: https://www.hejazfs.com.au/

Tukr is a rapidly expanding renewable commodities trader with a hyper-focus on direct origination of bio-feedstock material - primarily Used Cooking Oil and Palm Oil Mill Effluent for biodiesel production as well as Biodiesel itself. We develop complex supply chains within challenging locations to source sustainable and renewable materials for biofuel production. We bulk, store, blend and deliver these volumes to our end clients with attentive care to quality and sustainability compliance. Tukr relies on the efficiency and effectiveness of our supply management. We consider each of our regional warehouses to be a well-oiled machine. We count on exceptionally talented, bright, and committed people. We are looking for a Sales Admin Intern with details below:Responsible for administrative work (typing, filling document and data recap)Daily sales activity tracking (based on Google Docs and WhatsApp group)Analyze and process data based on daily visit Sales (simple analyst)Random check for sales call to ensure the call be accounted forIncentive tracking for sales and origins/sites dataOther ad-hoc duties Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in any majorFresh graduate or maximum has 2 years working experienceProficient with Excel & Google Sheets, databases, visualization and interpretationAnalytical, meticulous, and innovativeInitiative and ability to work independently, responsive, and adaptive to the team environment

7. Effective communication and training skills.
8. Strong project management skills and the ability to work collaboratively within a team.
9. Proficiency in software development and programming is a plus.

Description:We are looking for an Operations Strategic to define our company’s direction and develop plans to realize our business objectives. You will help us maintain our day to day operations and to ensure all of our operations process has run as planned. As operations strategic, you need to analyze all of the business processes and be driven with problem solving. Strategic thinking, project management and organizational operations are the most important skills in this role. If you also have experience in market research and business operations, we’d like to meet you. Ultimately, you will help our company adapt to changes and grow. Responsibilities:● Collect and analyze data to build a strong strategy and improve business process productivity● Provide insights in the company’s operational procedures and create plans to emerge system and break down strategic enhancement● Generate regular reports and ad-hoc in-depth evaluation of business operations performance● Prepare and coordinate with managers or other divisions, if needed, and communicate with the operational team regarding activity initiatives, marketing collateral, including but not limited to slides, proposals, script, Q&A, newsletter, flyers, etc.● Design and implement a project to accelerate the operations process to make sure all of the centers can achieve their target. Mainly working with multiple stakeholders to assist in the coordination of internal multi-projects.● Provide deep analysis and recommendations for new initiatives or business models and drive processes.● Evaluate industry trends and growth and make recommendations on changes to the focus and resource allocation.● Conduct research about the market competition to identify threats and opportunities, also industry trends and market changes Required Skills/Abilities:● BA in Business Administration, Marketing, Finance, Statistic or any related field; MSc/MA/MBA is a plus.● Minimum 2-3 years proven experience as a Strategic Planner / Business Consultant / Project Management● Demonstrating strong analytics and research skills● Excellent in project management, communication, and leadership skills● Familiar to work with Google Workspace (Google Spreadsheet / Ms. Excel is the must)

We are expanding our team! Ksatria is seeking highly motivated individuals, including nurses, doctors, hospital staff, and experienced software implementors, to join us as Software Implementation Specialists. In this role, you will play a pivotal part in deploying and demonstrating our health information software, aimed at enhancing patient care across Indonesia and overseas. Responsibilities: Implement health information software to meet the specific needs of our customers' healthcare facilities. Work closely with our software development team to address technical challenges and enhance software functionality. Conduct training sessions for healthcare staff on effectively utilizing the health information software to improve patient care and workflow efficiency. Uphold data privacy regulations and ensure the confidentiality of patient information. Assess the software's impact and suggest improvements for optimal performance. Analytical Skills: Possess strong analytical abilities to evaluate complex data and workflows, identify issues, and develop solutions that enhance system performance and user experience. (Preferred) Project Management: Experience in managing projects, including planning, allocating resources, and handling risks, will be highly advantageous for successful software implementation in healthcare settings. Requirements: Degree in Medicine, Nursing, or relevant healthcare field; or significant experience in software implementation within healthcare settings. Demonstrated experience in implementing health information software in a clinical environment. Excellent English communication skills, both verbal and written. Profound understanding of data privacy laws, clinical workflows, medical terminology, and healthcare operations. Commitment to maintaining patient confidentiality is paramount. Ability to work both independently and collaboratively within a team. We Offer: Competitive salary and benefits package. A dynamic, fast-paced work environment in the healthcare sector. An opportunity to significantly impact patient care through technology. If you are passionate about leveraging technology to enhance healthcare and have a successful track record in health information software implementation, we invite you to apply for this exciting role!

OverviewOur company is seeking a skilled Odoo Functional Support who is passionate about evaluating the Odoo project and transforming our client business processes into abstract and algorithmic business models. You will be responsible to transform the use cases of our clients’ business into logical and technical views. There are many tasks that have been performed these include customizing the processes at the optimum level to ensure the Odoo system reacts according to the flow. You also provide clients with documentation, and guidelines on each and every aspect of your department. You will also act as a backbone to the engineering team as they transform the technical code into functional areas which can be used by a layman.
Job DescriptionsExcellent in understanding business processes, where you must have knowledge of different business areas including the design of the business flow, and prepare documentation with a complete understanding of the business processTo understand each company's needs & pain points with respect to Odoo software implementation. Evaluation of client demands for Odoo and how a solution can be provided to enhance business processesMake sure that the software responds and reacts in the manner client is looking out for. Job Description:As an ERP System Analyst at our organization, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the effective implementation, maintenance, and enhancement of our Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to analyze business processes, identify areas for improvement, and provide technical solutions to optimize our ERP systems. As a pivotal member of our team, the ERP System Analyst will be integral in fortifying the efficiency of our Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems, specifically tailored for the pharmaceutical domain encompassing both wholesale and retail pharmacy operations. Your role will involve in-depth analysis, strategic enhancements, and seamless integration of ERP solutions to meet the unique requirements of our pharmacy-centric business. Responsibilities include:System Analysis:Conduct a comprehensive analysis of current ERP systems to identify opportunities for streamlining pharmacy operations.Collaborate closely with pharmacy stakeholders to define and document system requirements tailored to the wholesale and retail pharmacy environments.Implementation and Integration:Lead the implementation of ERP system upgrades, ensuring alignment with pharmaceutical industry regulations.Integrate ERP solutions with pharmacy-specific systems, emphasizing the secure and compliant flow of sensitive pharmaceutical data.Customization and Configuration:Customize ERP systems to cater to the distinct needs of pharmacy workflows.Configure ERP modules to optimize inventory management, prescription processing, and regulatory compliance.Troubleshooting and Support:Provide specialized technical support for pharmacy-specific ERP functionalities.Investigate and troubleshoot system errors with a focus on minimizing disruptions to pharmacy operations.Collaboration:Collaborate extensively with pharmacy and IT teams to ensure the seamless integration of ERP solutions with pharmaceutical business goals.Establish effective communication channels with pharmaceutical vendors and partners for system integrations.Documentation:Maintain detailed documentation of pharmacy-specific ERP configurations and customizations.Develop and update user manuals and training materials tailored for pharmacy staff.Training and Development:Conduct specialized training sessions for pharmacy staff on ERP system functionalities, emphasizing pharmacy best practices.Stay abreast of pharmaceutical industry trends and integrate relevant technologies into ERP systems. Qualification :Education:Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field.Experience:Minimum of 5 years of experience in ERP system analysis, implementation, and support, preferably within the pharmaceutical sector.Proven experience working with ERP solutions tailored for pharmaceuticals, such as SAP, Oracle, Microsoft Dynamics or others.Technical Skills:Proficient in customizing and configuring ERP systems for pharmacy workflows.Solid understanding of ERP modules related to pharmaceutical supply chain, purchasing, inventory management, finance, back office and POS.Knowledge of database management systems and SQL.Communication and Collaboration:Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to bridge the gap between IT and pharmacy stakeholders.Collaborative approach to working with cross-functional teams.Problem-Solving:Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, particularly in addressing challenges specific to pharmacy operations.Ability to innovate and optimize pharmacy processes through ERP solutions.Adaptability:Ability to adapt to evolving pharmaceutical regulations and technologies.Eagerness to learn and incorporate emerging trends in pharmacy ERP systems.Certifications:Relevant certifications in ERP systems, especially those focused on pharmaceuticals, are highly desirable.Project Management:Basic understanding of project management principles, with an emphasis on delivering projects within the pharmaceutical industry timelines.If you are passionate about revolutionizing ERP systems for the pharmaceutical landscape and possess the outlined qualifications, we encourage you to apply and contribute to the success of our pharmacy-focused business.

Halo Robotics adalah distributor dan penyedia layanan drone komersial terbesar di Indonesia, yang menyediakan solusi drone lengkap di setiap industri, termasuk Minyak dan Gas, Pertambangan, Pertanian, Ketenagalistrikan, Konstruksi, Keamanan, Pemadam Kebakaran, Polisi, dan Militer. Halo Robotics merupakan distributor eksklusif DJI Enterprise, produsen drone terbesar di dunia, dan mewakili pemimpin global di setiap kategori teknologi drone komersial di Indonesia. Halo Robotics juga bekerja sama dengan distributor ICT dan integrator sistem terkemuka di Indonesia untuk merancang dan memasok sistem drone lengkap pada skala perusahaan, dengan aplikasi utama termasuk Inspeksi otomatis, Pemantauan Kebakaran, Keamanan, Pengawasan & Respons Situasi.Kandidat yang ideal akan memiliki karakter profesional yang kuat, dan antusias terhadap tantangan baru untuk membangun keterampilan dan karier mereka di lingkungan kerja yang dinamis, berteknologi tinggi, dan berkembang pesat.Kami mencari seorang profesional dengan latar belakang LiDAR Data Processing Staff: Kualifikasi:Sarjana Geodesi / Geografi Berpengalaman dalam bidang photogrammetry, kartografi, remote sensing.Memiliki pengalaman dalam pemetaan dalam konteks industri (pemetaan foto udara dan LiDAR)Memiliki pengalaman dalam proses data foto udara dari Drone, data LiDAR, data titik kontrol (GCP/ICP), klasifikasi data LiDAR, digitasi data foto udara, kartografi, pembuatan peta. Tanggung jawab:Mempelajari dan melakukan riset mengenai teknologi yang dijual dan dipasarkan oleh Halo Robotics yang mencakup teknologi drone, sensor dan software terkait dengan solusi drone dalam bidang pemetaan dan inspeksi. Sensor mencakup RGB orthomosaic, LiDAR, Hyperspectral, Multispectral, GPS Geodetik dan lainnya. Software mencakup processing dan GIS software: Pix4D, Agisoft, ArcGIS, GlobalMapper, CloudCompare, LiDAR processing software dan software lainnya.Bertanggung jawab sepenuhnya atas pekerjaan yang mencakup proses data foto udara dan LiDAR, klasifikasi data, digitasi data, strip adjustment, penyesuaian akurasi, produksi peta dan data akhir dan pekerjaan terkait yang dibutuhkan oleh Perusahaan maupun Klien Perusahaan.Menyelesaikan dan mengerjakan seluruh kebutuhan post processing data GIS baik yang diminta secara internal Perusahaan ataupun project dari Client.After-sales: Berkomunikasi dengan client Perusahaan dalam hal membantu permasalahan yang dihadapi oleh client mengenai kesulitan troubleshooting peralatan drone dan proses data dari Klien.Berkomunikasi dan bekerja sama dengan rekan-rekan pihak ketiga Perusahaan untuk meningkatkan ilmu dan pengetahuan tim internal Perusahaan.Bertanggung jawab atas pengurusan dokumen administrasi, ISO, sertifikasi tender yang diikuti oleh perusahaan dan mencarikan solusi bagi kekurangan dokumen.Memastikan bahwa seluruh syarat-syarat dan skup administratif dalam suatu manajemen proyek diselesaikan dengan baik dan mendukung kelancaran proyek yang sedang diikuti perusahaan.

PT. Collins Higgins Commodities has designed, built and implemented a digital system that supports their field operations sourcing agricultural commodities. We are seeking a Digital Systems Officer with a passion and understanding of the importance of data quality, accuracy and timeliness with the technical know-how to translate the data into tangible data-driven insights. This role requires a passion for interrogating and making sense of data to support this system.  The Digital Systems Team is responsible for the development and maintenance of the CHC digital systems which includes mobile app development for data collection, server and systems development and business intelligence tools. A key function of the role is monitoring data collected (using custom built apps and dashboards), cleaning the data and following up on anomalies with the team responsible for inputting the data to ensure it is 100% accurate when used by management. The position offers the opportunity to design and build new forms and apps and dashboards and adapt data model blueprints as the need arises. This position requires minimum 2 years workforce experience for a talented individual with the right attitude, an inquisitive mind and attention to detail to identify data that ‘doesn’t look right’. The role combines fieldwork with data-related technical support and provision of one-on-one or group training. The Digital Systems Officer will have the opportunity to work within a supportive team environment but also independently, with tailored training support (based on need) provided. This position is ideally based in Padang, West Sumatra but CHC will consider Bali Head Office for the right candidate. Duties and ResponsibilitiesData management, monitoring and analysisMonitor incoming data from field activities and troubleshoot issues. Alert supervisors of any key issues (mechanical data).Ensure data is clean and usable for analysis, and follow up with the team to resolve mechanical data issues present in the data.Develop and follow prescribed workflows for data revisions.Report on data variables as requested.Identify user issues through data monitoring and analysis activities and retrain as necessary to avoid repeated problems. Develop digital data collection mobile apps and internal facing operational dashboardsPlan and build new forms and apps for mobile digital data collection (Commcare or other applications) as the opportunity arises.Ensure all support material for apps and dashboards is developed.Assist users with device and data collection troubleshooting in the field.Design and develop systems for presentation of internal facing business intelligence using the Zoho Analytics platform Support the deployment of digital data collection apps Train users on new apps and forms to ensure data collected is clear and free from errors.Field visits may be required where new apps are deployed.Conduct internal testing for new data collection apps and forms as needed.Create training materials for capacity building activities in mobile data collection.Conduct data collection and training/retraining for the field team in the Standard Operating Procedures in relation to app use, data collection and management. IT mentoring and communicationAct as a technical mentor for other staff working with mobile devices and/or data.Assist management access data for reporting.Assist other team members working with data, dashboards and data collection apps to understand key requirements or metrics. Data warehouse development.Create charts and document data with algorithms, parameters, models, and relations explanations.Perform SQL querying for best results.Use filters and graphs for a better understanding of the data.Make technical changes to existing BI systems in order to enhance their working. Management and ReportingThis position reports to the Digital & Data Systems Team ManagerDaily and weekly technical tasks and priorities will be assigned by the designated activity lead Qualifications, Skills, ExperienceEssentialMinimum 2 years experience with data management and/or cleaning activitiesUndergraduate (S1) qualifications in a ICT or related disciplineA sufficiently broad knowledge of technologies to design integrated systems in low-resource settingsSound knowledge of database management, data modeling, SQL, querying, data warehousingExperience with Google suite applications and conducting simple data analysis using Google sheets or MS excelDocumenting, designing and modeling solutionsHigh general technical aptitude and competenciesAn analytical and problem-solving mindset and approachFluent in written and spoken business EnglishGood communication skillsDesirableExperience working in rural areas/ company operation sitesExperience using and managing digital data collection softwareExperience in using data intelligence software (e.g. MS Power BI, Zoho Analytics, CommCare) or an interest to learnExperience delivering group training and presentationsExperience with SQL or an interest to learnA background in mathematics or similar fieldExperience working with warehousing workflow dataQualities Attention to detailProblem solver Self motivatedDemonstrated initiativePersonable Organised

Panin Sekuritas is looking for an Associate Economist.Please apply if you are interested in working with a dynamic team that is passionate about beating the market volatility while gaining precious experience.Key Responsibilities : 
- Monitor economic trends, and create statistical models to predict future developments.
- Study complex data and statistics and use their findings to provide financial advice to businesses.
- Involve in fixed-income analysis, which analyzes debt or fixed-income securities to make recommendations regarding possible investment strategies.
- Prepare presentation material for clients’ visits.
- Liaise with clients (investors/analysts) and companies (corporate secretary/investor relations) to produce fruitful results for both sides.Key Requirements :
- Possess at least a Bachelor's Degree in Economics. Fresh graduates are welcome
- Having a passion for the capital market.

- Have experience in capital markets, securities, asset management, banking, insurance, or other financial institutions related, including research experience.
- Excellent knowledge of macro & microeconomics, monetary & fiscal policies, and market structure.
- Have a good analytical, information-seeking, business orientation, and organizational commitment.
- Able to work individually as well as team.

About usPT Bank Multiarta Sentosa Tbk (Bank MAS) didirikan tahun 1992 sebagai bank umum, dan telah memperoleh izin usaha perdagangan valuta asing pada tahun 2013. Pada tahun 2013, Bank MAS resmi bergabung dengan Wings Group, sebuah perusahaan produk jadi terkemuka di Indonesia. Bank MAS mulai beroperasi sebagai Bank Devisa pada tahun 2016, dan mencatatkan sahamnya sebagai perusahaan terbuka di Bursa Efek pada tahun 2021. Bank MAS sebagai anggota Wings Group, bekerja sama dengan ekosistem Wings Group untuk mempercepat inklusi keuangan di Indonesia.Qualifications & experiencePengalaman  di industry banking dibidang yg sama min 3 tahun atau pengalaman sebagai analyst kredit commercial Mahir dalam program computer yg sesuai dengan job descriptionPengalaman minimal 3 tahunTasks & responsibilitiesMelakukan pemeriksaan terhadap setiap syarat-syarat pencairan kredit sebelum di disbursement oleh loan adminMelakukan monitoring pasca pencairan kredit terhadap syarat komite kredit yg sudah ditentukan di awal, jika ada penyimpangan terhadap hal tersebut melakukan report terhadap cabang terkait cc atasan.Melakukan monitoring pemenuhan action list (syarat2 kredit subsequent) dan membuat report secara berkala.Mahir didalam membuat reporting terhadap tugas-tugas secara komprehensif.

OVERVIEW
 At Trade Indy we are a fully independent specialist digital partner and trading desk working with largely independent agencies and direct clients across APAC. Trade Indy is headquartered in Melbourne delivering world-class programmatic campaigns for clients across display, video, mobile, and social also with an office in Bali, Indonesia. The Trade Indy team plans, executes, and optimises data-driven programmatic campaigns that allow advertisers to reach their ideal consumers across a variety of digital platforms with one campaign. Trade Indy’s proprietary technology ensures ad spend is executed in the most efficient way possible to deliver best-in-class programmatic campaigns across display, video, mobile, and social platforms. Trade Indy uses an optimum combination of private and public data sources to target based on demographics, behaviour, intent to purchase, and location to achieve a client’s campaign objectives. Our digital specialists demonstrate expertise in programmatic and social media advertising and a proven track record of delivering outstanding results for clients. The demands of this role will require someone who is highly analytical, able to pick out trends in data, and deliver meaningful insights and effective optimisations.  An adept problem solver with the ability to confidently act on initiative.  Client retention is essential to our business, and therefore, our team needs to present a can-do attitude and make themselves indispensable to all assigned clients.  The team is expected to carry out all aspects of client management, including fulfilment of all reporting requirements, campaign management, and assistance with new business pitches all the time, responding to and delivering on all reasonable requests in a timely fashion.  Above all, we deliver exceptional results for our clients.
 THE JOB
For the Digital Campaign Analyst position, we are seeking candidates with 1-2 years of relevant work experience to work in our Bali office and join our growing team. You will be tasked with transforming vast digital data sets into compelling and actionable insights. Not only will you help measure campaign performance, but you will also have the opportunity to work with our Campaign Optimisation team in Bali and Melbourne (Australia) to implement the resulting strategies based on your actionable insights.
 Responsibilities include:Gathering and organising data through various third-party platforms and analytics tools (e.g. SQREEM, Google Ads, Analytics & Data Studio/Lookr, META other Vendor Platforms).Analysing digital campaign data to inform strategy, formulate relevant insights, and provide client or internal Trade Indy teams with actionable campaign recommendations.Utilise data analytics tools and platforms to monitor campaign performance and identify trends and insights. Make data-driven decisions to optimise campaign strategies and achieve key performance indicators (KPIs).Ensuring that client-facing and internal reporting is done in a timely manner (Small Weekly Email update PLUS End of Campaign Insights via PowerPoint).Identifying opportunities to continuously improve processes.Build foundational knowledge about media tactics, terminology, and media execution processes (digital channels)Master key media/marketing analytics fundamentals and principlesBecome fluent with necessary media data sources/tools/utilitiesParticipating in the training process to acquire baseline knowledge of the Trade Indy way (an internal session with departments). Executing the measurement and reporting plan.
CANDIDATE
We encourage you to apply if the below describes your experience and talents:Currently based in Bali, Indonesia (relocation candidates will not be considered for this role).Excellent in both verbal and written English.A bachelor's degree in marketing, communications, business, or a related field is preferred.1-2 years experience in a full-time position.A strong desire to learn and a passion for digital marketing, research, and analyticsAbility to work well with others and work in cross-country teams/timezonesAbility to manage and prioritise a number of concurrent tasksAbility to clearly explain data insights and campaign optimisation ideas to multiple audiences both verbally and in writingExcellent organisational and multitasking abilities to manage multiple campaigns and meet deadlines simultaneously. Analyse campaign data and metrics to derive insights and make data-driven decisions.Desired Technical Skills:Experience/familiarity in ad-serving tools (Google Campaign Manager, Google Display & Video 360, Google AdWords, META Business Manager, Google Analytics, Google Dashboards (Lookr/DataStudio).Experience/familiarity with concepts of reporting design.Proficiency with Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint.Understanding how to use Pivot Tables in Microsoft Excel is highly desirable to help with analysing big data sets.Some familiarity with web technologies, including HTML and Javascript is a huge advantage.

OVERVIEW
 At Trade Indy we are a fully independent specialist digital partner and trading desk working with largely independent agencies and direct clients across APAC. Trade Indy is headquartered in Melbourne delivering world-class programmatic campaigns for clients across display, video, mobile, and social also with an office in Bali, Indonesia. The Trade Indy team plans, executes, and optimises data-driven programmatic campaigns that allow advertisers to reach their ideal consumers across a variety of digital platforms with one campaign. Trade Indy’s proprietary technology ensures ad spend is executed in the most efficient way possible to deliver best-in-class programmatic campaigns across display, video, mobile, and social platforms. Trade Indy uses an optimum combination of private and public data sources to target based on demographics, behaviour, intent to purchase, and location to achieve a client’s campaign objectives. Our digital specialists demonstrate expertise in programmatic and social media advertising and a proven track record of delivering outstanding results for clients. The demands of this role will require someone who is highly analytical, able to pick out trends in data, and deliver meaningful insights and effective optimisations.  An adept problem solver with the ability to confidently act on initiative.  Client retention is essential to our business, and therefore, our team needs to present a can-do attitude and make themselves indispensable to all assigned clients.  The team is expected to carry out all aspects of client management, including fulfilment of all reporting requirements, campaign management, and assistance with new business pitches all the time, responding to and delivering on all reasonable requests in a timely fashion.  Above all, we deliver exceptional results for our clients.
 THE JOB
For the Technical Analytics Executive position, we are seeking candidates with 1-2 years of relevant work experience to work in our Bali office and join our growing team. Your responsibilities are primarily to support all team members
(both in Asia and Australia) with technical questions, dashboard deployments, customer website tagging (with marketing / measurement tags) and
dashboard improvement/optimisation. In this role you will work closely with the Lead Analytics Engineer and Technical Project manager, and will be expected to resolve technical
problems is a fast-paced work environment

We encourage you to apply if the below describes your experience and talents:Currently based in Bali, Indonesia (relocation candidates will not be considered for this role).Excellent in both verbal and written English.A bachelor's degree or diploman in Technology / Web Development or a related field is preferred.1-2 years relevant work experience in a full-time position.A strong desire to learn and a passion for digital marketing, research, and analytics technology.Ability to work well with others and work in cross-country teams/timezonesAbility to manage and prioritise a number of concurrent tasksExcellent organisational and multitasking abilities to manage multiple campaigns and meet deadlines simultaneously. Analyse campaign data and metrics to derive insights and make data-driven decisions.Must Have Technical Skills:Ability to work in a fast-paced work environmentGood communication skillsComplex problem-solving abilityDashboarding experience (preferably Google Looker Studio [formerly Google Data Studio], but Microsoft Power BI, Tableau, etc are also acceptable)Understanding of and experience in ETLSQLBigQueryNice to have Technical Skills:PythonJavaScriptHTMLCSSGoogle Tag Manager

select: Credit Assessment & Anti Fraud Operational Risk Specialist
JobDescReq:
Job Descriptions:

1. Collect, compile and validate data from various sources to ensure quality and compliance of all Credit Assessment & Anti Fraud activities to ensure adherence to policies, procedures and regulatory requirements.
2. Collaborate with stakeholders to ensure the availability, integrity and quality of the Credit Assessment & Anti Fraud data and reporting for internal and regulator.
3. Perform comprehensive assessment and oversight on operational risk within Credit Assessment & Anti Fraud including process deficiencies, technology vulnerabilities and human errors.
4. Responsible for oversight operational risk management and activities in area of Credit Assessment & Anti Fraud  through communicating, validating and monitoring on the implementation of operational risk frameworks, policies and tools to ensure the effectiveness. 
5. Conduct Risk Control and Self-Assessment (RCSA) on regular basis to minimize operational risk and maintain integrity of Credit Assessment process.
6. Manage and investigate operational risk incidents, track root causes and develop action plans to avoid future occurrences.
7. Communicate findings and insights to various stakeholders, including senior management and related departments for timely risk mitigation. Job Requirements:

1. Bachelor’s / Master’s Degree in Computer Science/IT/Statistics/Engineer/ Mathematics / Statistics / Actuary or any other related fields.
2. Several years of experience in operational risk management, preferably in a financial service, Credit Assessment & Anti Fraud environment and unsecured loan / financing (credit card, personal loan, paylater).
3. Strong understanding of regulatory compliance related to Credit Assessment & Anti Fraud activities.
4. Familiar with risk assessment methodologies and tools.
5. Proficient in writing SQL queries and / or python or other data science programming language is preferred.
6. Fluent in written & oral English.
7. Willing to take on new challenges and work in a fast-paced environment.

select: Non Credit Support Operational Risk Specialist
JobDescReq:
Job Descriptions:

1. Collect, compile and validate data from various sources to ensure quality and compliance of all Non Credit Support activities including but not limited to Call Centre, IT & Telemarketing to ensure adherence to policies, procedures and regulatory requirements.
2. Collaborate with stakeholders to ensure the availability, integrity and quality of Non Credit Support data and reporting for internal and regulator.
3. Perform comprehensive assessment and oversight on operational risk within Non Credit Support (Call Centre, IT, Telemarketing) including process deficiencies, technology vulnerabilities and human errors.
4. Responsible for oversight operational risk management and activities in area of Non Credit Support through communicating, validating and monitoring on the implementation of operational risk frameworks, policies and tools to ensure the effectiveness. 
5. Conduct Risk Control and Self-Assessment (RCSA) on regular basis to minimize operational risk and maintain integrity of Non Credit Support (Call Centre, IT, Telemarketing) process.
6. Manage and investigate operational risk incidents, track root causes and develop action plans to avoid future occurrences.
7. Communicate findings and insights to various stakeholders, including senior management and related departments for timely risk mitigation.  Job Requirements:

1. Bachelor’s / Master’s Degree in Computer Science/IT/Statistics/Engineer/ Mathematics / Statistics / Actuary or any other related fields.
2. Several years of experience in operational risk management, preferably in a financial service, Non Credit Support (Call Centre, IT, Telemarketing) and unsecured loan / financing (credit card, personal loan, paylater).
3. Strong understanding of regulatory compliance related to Non Credit Support (Call Centre, IT, Telemarketing) activities.
4. Familiar with risk assessment methodologies and tools.
5. Proficient in writing SQL queries and / or python or other data science programming language is preferred.
6. Fluent in written & oral English.
7. Willing to take on new challenges and work in a fast-paced environment.

Responsibilities:Monitoring & conducting detailed portfolio analysis daily.Analyzing monthly or ongoing project portfolio quality.Advising portfolio risk and preparing action taken needed.Preparing and developing portfolio reports, Understanding of financial ratio.Understand regulatory restrictions that may impact to portfolio management.Offer risk management on business analysis and research into business expertise area.
- Determine risks and opportunities within credit portfolio processes and strategy.Requirement:Min 3 years of experience working in Portfolio & Risk Management Team in Financing, Venture Capital and Fintech Companies.Good and strong knowledge of OJK for financing company industry processes and regulations.An analytical mindset with excellent excel & macro skills.Recommend strategies to limit risk and can provide a wide range of differing degrees of acceptable riskStrong interpersonal skills, good analytical, and detail-orientedGood command of English and computer literateFast, Adaptive, and willing to learn.

Chandra Asri Group is a leading chemical and infrastructure solutions company in Indonesia with a track record of over 31 years in the petrochemical industry. The company employs over 2,000 dedicated staff, incorporates state-of-the art technologies and supporting facilities located strategically in the country’s industrial hub, Cilegon and Serang. Job Descriptions: 

1. Collect, clean, and preprocess data from various sources to ensure accuracy and completeness. 
2. Analyze and interpret complex datasets using statistical and data visualization techniques to identify potential risks and trends.
3. Collaborate with risk management teams to define risk metrics and develop models for assessing and quantifying risks. 
4. Monitor and track key risk indicators (KRIs) and key performance indicators (KPIs) to identify emerging risks and trends.
5. Produce comprehensive reports and presentations summarizing risk analysis findings for stakeholders and senior management. 
6. Collaborate with IT teams to ensure data integrity, security, and compliance with data protection regulations.
7. Participate in the development and improvement of risk management strategies, policies, and procedures. 
8. Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in risk management and data analysis. 


Job Requirements: 
1. Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as Finance, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or Computer Science. 
2. Proven experience (3+ years) in data analysis or a related field (Financial Technology is a plus). 
3. Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Python, or SQL, and experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI). 
4. Strong proficiency in Ms. Excel 
5. Knowledge of ISO 27001 is a plus point 
6. Familiarity with financial products, markets, and regulatory requirements is a plus. 
7. Excellent analytical skills with the ability to work with complex, large datasets and draw actionable insights. 
8. Strong communication skills to convey complex findings and insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. 
9. Detail-oriented mindset with a focus on accuracy and precision in data analysis. 
10. Ability to work collaboratively in cross-functional teams and adapt to changing priorities. 
11. Problem-solving mindset and the ability to think critically and creatively to address emerging risks. 
12. Professional certifications related to risk management or data analysis (e.g., FRM, CFA, CRMA) are desirable but not mandatory.
13. English/Chinese is preferred (HSK 5 Chinese proficiency)

This role maintains a strong working partnership with the Training Manager and CSS Training Team (U.S.), to support the delivery of any new and/or existing training material, identify opportunities to enhance the training schedule and practical application exercises, as well as provide feedback through the quality assurance process.  In addition, this individual will support by providing feedback to coach technicians, focusing on customer experience, while identifying and/or evaluating the individual technical skill sets for continuous training and development.Duties and ResponsibilitiesExecute published training plans in English, including practical applications, support resources, and daily training summaries. On-site training facilitation and coordination of all training materials, and physical setup, in addition to partnering with the Training Manager to coordinate the schedule of attendees.Recognize knowledge trends in individuals and teams in both technical and procedural aspects, including customer service feedback from the quality assurance processes.Identify opportunities to advance individuals’ technical knowledge and capabilities through appropriate training courses and coaching with the Training manager’s partnership.Determine and deliver refresher training needs or additional practical application exercises, based on technician’s metrics and customer feedback.Partner with the CSS Training Team (U.S.) and business partners to support the development and delivery of training within new/existing areas, in addition to ongoing learning modules.Review calls/cases to investigate possible problem areas and opportunities, including client responses via the use of English.Competencies To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies: Technical Capacity & Problem Solving – Demonstrates in-depth of knowledge and skills encompassing all technical areas of training content and desk support.  Effectively applies technical knowledge to find resolutions for practical application exercises while being able to train in English simultaneously. Communication & Professionalism – Articulates clearly and concisely in English both verbally and written, using proper grammar and professionalism with verbal and written communication. Approaches others in a professional, respectful manner; Responds well under pressure; Takes ownership and responsibility for own actions. Follows through on commitments and keeps leadership apprised of training plan progress. Training & Innovation: Supports the Training Manager with evaluating technician’s skill-set levels, capacity and/or willingness to learn and grow.  Work closely with the Subject Matter Experts from our business partners to understand technical skills and application of training material. Partners with Training Manager, CSS Training Team, and business partner, to ensure technical training information is up-to-date, consistent and provides visibility to support resources for all technicians.Results Orientation & Quality Management – Self-driven, focused on setting goals through day-to-day with the ability to grow, while leading by example to peers. Ability to maintain schedule flexibility with timelines surrounding goals and expectations, while maintaining professionalism. Identifies ways to improve and promote quality through the customer and employee experience while executing accuracy, consistency and closes the loop.  Must complete at least 6 – 8 quality assurance reviews per day, totaling 30 – 40 by the close of each business week.  This includes providing each technician feedback (at least 1 review per person per week) around their written and verbal communication with our customers to ensure the customer care model is executed to provide exceptional customer service.             Language Skills Must be proficient in communicating in English - verbal and written. At least two years working in a business environment with English as the primary language.Any certifications in English Language is a plus.Identify appropriate correspondence channel and displays professionalism when communicating feedback with Training Manager, CSS Training Team, Subject Matter Experts, and business partners.Strong English communication skills including the ability to speak over the phone, present information in small or large groups in person and or remote and facilitate group discussions.  Reasoning Ability                                                                                   Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw conclusions.Ability to interpret a variety of instructions and solve problems with a logical, analytical approach.Ability to effectively present solutions in English with business partners, CSS Training Team (U.S.), Training Manager, and Operations Manager.  Other Skills and Abilities                Strong time management, organizational skills, and self-awareness, with the capability multi-task in a fast-paced environment. Position Type / Expected Hours of Work                                                                                                    This is a full-time position.  Days and hours of work may vary. This role must be flexible to work different shifts as training needs require

We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join our team and contribute to our data-driven decision-making process. As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing and developing complex logical database designs, logical data models, and relational data definitions in support of corporate and customer information systems requirements. Understand the methodologies and technologies that depict the flow of data within and between technology systems and business functions/operations. Responsible for the identification and resolution of information flow, content challenges, and the transformation of business needs into logical data models. This role finds ways to lessen redundant data, patterns in data usage, and various data sources.Responsibilities : 
1. Collect, clean, and preprocess data from various sources to ensure accuracy and completeness.
2. Apply statistical techniques and perform advanced analytics to extract insights and identify trends.
3. Create visualisations, reports, and dashboards to effectively communicate data insights.
4. Track and analyse key performance indicators (KPIs) to assess performance and identify areas for improvement.
5. Work with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to understand their data needs and provide analytical support.
6. Ensure data integrity through validation, quality control, and adherence to data governance standards.
7. Identify opportunities for automation, streamline workflows, and enhance data analysis processes.
8. Stay updated with industry trends, tools, and techniques in data analysis.
9. Ensure compliance with data privacy regulations and maintain data confidentiality.Requirements : 
1. Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.
2. At least 3 years of experience as a Data Analyst or similar roles
3. Strong knowledge of SQL, Power BI, and database systems.
4. Proficiency in programming languages commonly used for data analysis, such as Python or R.
5. Strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities.
6. Demonstrated experience in data understanding and analysis is important.
7. Experience with data visualisation tools or any analytics application.
8. A team player with the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.
9. Self-motivated and able to work with minimal guidance.
10. Fluent communication in the English language, both spoken and written, is a must.
